utils package¶

Submodules¶

utils.beliefstate module¶

This module provides the BeliefState class.

class BeliefState(domain: utils.domain.jsonlookupdomain.JSONLookupDomain)[source]¶

Bases: object

The representation of a belief state.

Can be accessed like a dict, e.g. state[‘beliefs’][‘food’][‘italian’] The history of the belief state can be accessed by using indexes 0 is the first turn, -1 is the current turn

Example: state[-2][‘beliefs’][‘area’][‘north’] returns the probability of area=north in the last turn

get_most_probable_inf_beliefs(consider_NONE: bool = True, threshold: float = 0.7, max_results: int = 1, turn_idx: int = -1)[source]¶

Extract the most probable value for each system requestable slot

If the most probable value for a slot does not exceed the threshold, then the slot will not be added to the result at all.

Parameters

  • beliefstate – beliefstate dict

  • consider_NONE – If True, slots where NONE values have the highest probability will not be added to the result. If False, slots where NONE values have the highest probability will look for the best value != NONE.

  • threshold – minimum probability to be accepted to the

  • max_results – return at most #max_results best values per slot

  • turn_idx – index for accessing the belief state history (default = -1: use last turn)

Returns

A dict with mapping from slots to a list (if max_results > 1) or a float (if max_results == 1) of values containing the slots which have at least one value whose probability exceeds the specified threshold.

get_most_probable_sysreq_beliefs(consider_NONE: bool = True, threshold: float = 0.7, max_results: int = 1, turn_idx: int = -1)[source]¶

Extract the most probable value for each system requestable slot

If the most probable value for a slot does not exceed the threshold, then the slot will not be added to the result at all.

Parameters

  • beliefstate – beliefstate dict

  • consider_NONE – If True, slots where NONE values have the highest probability will not be added to the result. If False, slots where NONE values have the highest probability will look for the best value != NONE.

  • threshold – minimum probability to be accepted to the

  • max_results – return at most #max_results best values per slot

  • turn_idx – index for accessing the belief state history (default = -1: use last turn)

Returns

A dict with mapping from slots to a list (if max_results > 1) or a float (if max_results == 1) of values containing the slots which have at least one value whose probability exceeds the specified threshold.

get_requested_slots(threshold: float = 0.7, turn_idx: int = -1)[source]¶
Returns the slots requested by the user with

probability > threshold and slotname != NONE

Parameters

turn_idx – index for accessing the belief state history (default = -1: use last turn)

start_new_turn()[source]¶

ONLY to be called by the belief state tracker at the begin of each turn, to ensure the correct history can be accessed correctly by other modules

update_num_dbmatches()[source]¶

Updates the belief state’s entry for the number of database matches given the constraints in the current turn.

utils.goal module¶

class Goal(domain: utils.domain.jsonlookupdomain.JSONLookupDomain, parameters=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

The class representing a goal, therefore containing requests and constraints.

Parameters

  • domain (Domain) – The domain for which the goal will be instantiated.

  • will only work within this domain. (It) –

  • parameters (dict) – The parameters for the goal defined by a key=value mapping: ‘MinVenues’

  • allows to set a minimum number of venues which fulfill the constraints of the goal, ((int)) –

  • 'MinConstraints' (int) and 'MaxConstraints' (int) –

  • respectively, 'MinRequests' (constraints) –

  • amount of requests respectively and 'Reachable' (maximum) –

  • percent) of all generated goals are definitely fulfillable (i.e. there exists a venue ((in) –

  • the current goal) or not (for) –

  • equals 1.0 implicitly states that 'MinVenues' equals 1 or more, the ('Reachable') –

  • looks different, is more efficient and takes all goals into consideration (implementation) –

  • 'Reachable' is a float ((since) –

  • to any number bigger than 0 forces every goal to be fulfillable. ('MinVenues') –

  • value (str) – The value the request slot will be filled with.

init(random_goal=True, constraints=None, requests=None)[source]¶

Initializes a goal randomly OR using the given constraints and requests.

Parameters

  • random_goal (bool) – If True, a goal will be drawn randomly from available constraints

  • requests (dict) –

  • and requests are given and both don't equal None, this parameter is (constraints) –

  • as False. If False, the given constraints and requests are used. (considered) –

  • constraints (List[Constraint]) – The constraints which will be used for the goal.

  • requests – The requests which will be used for the goal.

is_fulfilled()[source]¶

Checks whether all requests have been fulfilled.

Returns

True if all requests have been fulfilled, False otherwise.

Return type

bool

Note

Does not check whether the venue (issued by the system) fulfills the constraints since it’s the system’s task to give an appropriate venue by requesting the user’s constraints.

is_inconsistent_constraint(constraint)[source]¶

Checks whether the given constraint is consistent with the goal. A constraint is also consistent if it’s value is ‘dontcare’ in the current goal.

Parameters

constraint (Constraint) – The constraint which will be checked for consistency.

Returns

True if values match or value in goal is ‘dontcare’, False otherwise.

Return type

bool

is_inconsistent_constraint_strict(constraint)[source]¶

Checks whether the given constraint is strictly consistent with the goal, whereby ‘dontcare’ is treated as a different value (no match).

Parameters

constraint (Constraint) – The constraint which will be checked for consistency.

Returns

True if values match, False otherwise.

Return type

bool

See also

is_inconsistent_constraint()

reset()[source]¶

Resets all requests of the goal.

update_constraint(slot, value)[source]¶

Update a given constraint slot with value.

Parameters

  • slot (str) – The constraint slot which will be updated.

  • value (str) – The value with which the constraint will be updated.

Returns

True if update was successful, i.e. the constraint slot is included in the goal, False otherwise.

Return type

bool

utils.logger module¶

This module provides a logger for configurable output on different levels.

class DiasysLogger(name: str = 'adviser', console_log_lvl: utils.logger.LogLevel = <LogLevel.ERRORS: 40>, file_log_lvl: utils.logger.LogLevel = <LogLevel.NONE: 100>, logfile_folder: str = 'logs', logfile_basename: str = 'log')[source]¶

Bases: logging.Logger

Logger class.

This class enables logging to both a logfile and the console with different information levels. It also provides logging methods for the newly introduced information levels (LogLevel.DIALOGS and LogLevel.RESULTS).

If file_level is set to LogLevel.NONE, no log file will be created. Otherwise, the output directory can be configured by setting log_folder.

dialog_turn(msg: str, dialog_act=None)[source]¶

Logs a turn of a dialog

result(msg: str)[source]¶

Logs the result of a dialog

class LogLevel[source]¶

Bases: enum.IntEnum

The available levels for the logger.

DIALOGS = 18¶
ERRORS = 40¶
INFO = 20¶
NONE = 100¶
RESULTS = 19¶
class MultilineFormatter(fmt=None, datefmt=None, style='%')[source]¶

Bases: logging.Formatter

A formatter for the logger taking care of multiline messages.

format(record: logging.LogRecord)[source]¶

Format the specified record as text.

The record’s attribute dictionary is used as the operand to a string formatting operation which yields the returned string. Before formatting the dictionary, a couple of preparatory steps are carried out. The message attribute of the record is computed using LogRecord.getMessage(). If the formatting string uses the time (as determined by a call to usesTime(), formatTime() is called to format the event time. If there is exception information, it is formatted using formatException() and appended to the message.

exception_logging_hook(exc_type, exc_value, exc_traceback)[source]¶

Used as a hook to log exceptions.

utils.useract module¶

This module provides the necessary classes for a user action.

class UserAct(text: str = '', act_type: utils.useract.UserActionType = None, slot: str = None, value: str = None, score: float = 1.0)[source]¶

Bases: object

The class for a user action as used in the dialog.

Parameters

  • text (str) – A textual representation of the user action.

  • act_type (UserActionType) – The type of the user action.

  • slot (str) – The slot to which the user action refers - might be None depending on the user action. Default: None.

  • value (str) – The value to which the user action refers - might be None depending on the user action. Default: None.

  • score (float) – A value from 0. (not important) to 1. (important) indicating how important the information is for the belief state. Default: 1.0.
